subject: Sleep
title: Advanced Sleep Phase Disorder
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Advanced Sleep Phase Disorder.

hook.text: A retiree falls asleep at 7 PM and wakes at 3 AM, unable to sleep any more. He's tried everything.

buildup.text: Advanced sleep phase disorder shifts the circadian clock several hours earlier than normal.

discovery.text: It's the mirror image of delayed phase. The person sleeps well but at socially inconvenient early times.

twist.text: It's more common in older adults because the circadian clock naturally advances with aging.

climax.text: Evening bright light exposure can delay the clock, but the shift is hard to maintain long-term.

punchline.text: Falling asleep at sunset is a real medical condition.

quiz.question: Who is most likely to have advanced sleep phase disorder?
